body_html:
Hi @junshi15
This is not the case I'm seeing in my case.
I get ACKs to all REQUEST/RESPONSES, and everything looks good from the verbs protocol side.
I even checked hash collision in the buffer table - and it's not it as well.

After serious debug, it looks like something wrong with the step_id handling.
I'm not sure it's related to the verbs code directly, but something in Distributed TF, with the timing happens only with: RDMA && large number of GPUS && loading ImageNet from storage.

body:
Hi @junshi15 
This is not the case I'm seeing in my case.
I get ACKs to all REQUEST/RESPONSES, and everything looks good from the verbs protocol side.
I even checked hash collision in the buffer table - and it's not it as well.

After serious debug, it looks like something wrong with the step_id handling.
I'm not sure it's related to the verbs code directly, but something in Distributed TF, with the timing happens only with: RDMA && large number of GPUS && loading ImageNet from storage.
